properties.name: Java Trench
properties.description: The Java Trench was formed by subduction, or one tectonic plate pushing another. Subduction can create trenches, mountains, or island arcs, and often causes seismic and volcanic activity.

properties.name: Molloy Hole
properties.description: Trenches are depths of over 6,000 meters, which is why the Molloy Hole is not a trench. The Molloy Hole was formed by seafloor spreading, or tectonic plates moving away from each other.

properties.name: South Sandwich Trench
properties.description: The area of the ocean beyond a depth of 6000 meters is called the Hadal zone. The South Sandwich Trench is the only sub-zero temperature Hadal Zone on the planet.

properties.name: Puerto Rico Trench
properties.description: Trenches are home to unique species like deep-sea sponges, black corals, anemones, and jellyfish. The deep sea also positively impacts other ecosystems by acting as a sink for organic carbon.

properties.name: Mariana Trench
properties.description: Within this trench lies Challenger Deep, the deepest point on Earth. Microplastics have been discovered in Challenger Deep, displaying the far-reaching impacts of pollution.
